Other Information.Additional Info: H2 permeability of 4.95 Barrer at 900 °C pyrolysis temperature.
CO2 permeability decreased slightly from 0.069 Barrer at 2 bar to 0.066 Barrer at 15 bar for CANAL-850 °C CMS membrane.

Nitrogen permeabilities for CMS membranes pyrolyzed at 850 and 900 °C could not be measured accurately as the measurements were below the detection limit of the gas permeation equipment (<0.005 Barrer).

Methane permeabilities for CMS membranes pyrolyzed at 850 and 900 °C could not be measured accurately as the measurements were below the detection limit of the gas permeation equipment (<0.005 Barrer).

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2/CO2 selectivity of 248 at 35 °C for CANAL-900 °C; H2/CO2 mixed-gas selectivity of 174 at 100 °C and 10 bar feed pressure.

Other Information.Additional Info: The CANAL-900 °C exhibited the highest pure-and-mixed H2/CO2 selectivities, with values similar to the ultrathin 2D GO membrane. To the best of our knowledge, to date this is the highest pure-and-mixed H2/CO2 separation performance reported for CMS membranes at high pressure and temperature.
